list_definition.definition: something read for another to write down

list_ex_of_english: He hates dictations and spelling because he is dyslexic.
He has to buy and sell at his creditors dictation, and that is the road which has brought many a farmer to bankruptcy.
We asked children to spell to dictation two-morpheme words in which target clusters appeared in different morphemes of the word, either in the word stem or in the case inflection.
There is obviously a distinction between initiative and dictation but in this matter it is a thin one.
I am not fond of dictators or dictation.
We are not prepared to tolerate this kind of dictation.
Her priest and others were allegedly surprised that the handwritten pages included no overwrites, corrections or revisions and seemed somewhat like dictations.
The public are entitled to information, they are entitled to avoid dictation from us.
